1.title: The Raw Deal
1.plot: Actor/comedian, Ashleigh Nicole Johnson, dishes out a raw deal to both her best friend, Derrick, and her son Lucas. Watch as Ashleigh catches both guys by surprise when she's asked to help with moving and setting up the Easter Egg Hunt.

2.title: Distracted Comedy
2.plot: Stand-up comedian, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, takes the advice of her comedian friend, Derek, and begins to research comedians for her stand-up act but quickly becomes distracted by - EVERYTHING. Watch to see how the Groupon spokesperson and 'Girl Friend's Trip' actor/comedian, Tiffany Haddish, comes into play.

3.title: Carrey-isms
3.plot: In an attempt to perfect her "stand-up comedy" routine and in the absence of her friend, Derrick, who is just too busy to help, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, seeks advice from one of her favorite comedian actors, Jim Carrey. Watch and see if Ashleigh is a good student of comedy or if she needs more help.

4.title: Coaching for Donuts
4.plot: Actor/comedian, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, seeks advice from a stand-up comedy coach and boy is it FIRE. This coach demands something very specific for payment. He also suggests that she do some interesting things in order to be better at comedy. Watch to see what happens.

5.title: Yogi Issues
5.plot: Actor/comedian, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, tries yoga, meditation, and "Burnette Shenanigans" to tap into her inner stand-up comedian only to have it all fall a part because she forgot the wig. Watch to see what this "mom-a-ste" does to create inner sanctum.

6.title: Fire Works
6.plot: In this episode actor/comedian, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, recalls the instructions of her acting coach, "...You stare that flame dead in its burners." As part of doing the work, Ashleigh finds several flames, with several burners, for her to stare dead into. Its through the fire that Ashleigh reaches her AHA. moment. Watch as she applies her character connection to the Jim Carrey character, "Fireman Bill," and - "Let (her) show you somethin'."

7.title: To Share or Not to Share...
7.plot: In this episode actor/comedian, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, contemplates whether she has taught her son, Lucas, the right life lessons to successfully function in society. As a mom, Ashleigh questions herself whether she should teach her son to share or not to share especially when he comes home shirtless the first day of Kindergarten. In this episode, Ashleigh calls upon all she knows as a mom, as an actor, as a comedian, even as a stand-up comedian to answer this hypocritical question. Watch as she tries to prove to herself that she shouldn't get her "Great Mom" card ...

8.title: Buggin' for Bucks, Part 1
8.plot: actor/comedian, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, needs extra money. After bugging all of her close friends and family for help, Ashleigh is forced to turn to another form of buggin'. Watch to see how she pulls this one off.

9.title: Buggin' for Bucks, Part 2
9.plot: In this second part episode actor/comedian, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, has been hired as an exterminator!!. Watch to see how she handles buggin' for bucks.

10.title: Chewy Pizza
10.plot:

11.title: Finding Comedic Trinkets
11.plot:

13.title: The Last Minute Christmas

1.title: Dirty Laundry
1.plot: Ashleigh decides she wants to be a stand-up comedian at the Laugh Factory and goes around town to try out her jokes only to find out that her son, Lucas has told everyone at his school that his mom is a joke.

2.title: Stand-up, Stand-In, It's All the Same
2.plot: ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, fills us in on what it's like to be a STAND-UP or is it a STAND-IN???? at the Billboards. From Kevin Hart to craft service see what it's like to be behind the scenes of this award winning show.

3.title: Getting Schooled
3.plot: Ashleigh gets a job at a comedy school and boy does she get schooled.

4.title: PTA Misfit
4.plot: Ashleigh gets the bright idea to attend the PTA meeting at her son's school only to discover she may truly be a misfit.

5.title: PTA Misfit Part 2
5.plot: In this continuation we find out how the bake sale goes.

6.title: You Belong in the Shoebox
6.plot: Ashleigh tries her hand at "Yo Momma" jokes while also wedging herself into a McDonald's commercial only to discover, no one likes her shoes.

7.title: Popsicles for Breakfast
7.plot: Ashleigh is convinced that all she needs to do to stay relevant and in the comedy game is to tap into her inner child.

8.title: About Last Night...
8.plot: Ashleigh goes to a Networking event to meet people and to find opportunities to tell her jokes. Throughout the night she meets a dad, a Producer, The Rock, Michael Jackson, a bartender and an Uber driver...at least she thinks so. Watch as she reflects upon the great night she had.

9.title: Everyday She's Hustlin"
9.plot: Ashleigh hustles herself up on a job as a limousine driver who by the way, can also tell jokes. Ashleigh Nicole shows great skill at taking care of her car, unlocking locked doors, rolling down partitions, consciously driving around evangelicals, and telling eight jokes that even kids find funny. Watch to see how Ashleigh's skill gets her into tight spaces that only her boss and Uber can get her out of.

10.title: Casting Lucy
10.plot: Ashleigh auditions to replace Cate Blanchett to star as TV's pioneering star and physical comedy actress, Lucille Ball. Ashleigh covers many of Lucy's funny moments from the 'Vitameatavegamin' episode to the 'Chocolate Factory' episode. Watch as Casting sees how stocked with sweetness Ashleigh truly is, while Derrick, Ashleigh's blatantly honest and supportive friend, gets and earful.

11.title: Lasting Impressions
11.plot: Ashleigh gets an expected, unexpected visit from Lucas' teacher. See how Ashleigh answers the questions that all moms should know the answers to, with the operative word being, "should." By the way, do you want some pickles?

12.title: I bet I can make you laugh
12.plot: Ashleigh challenges her stand-up comedian friend, Derrick, to a contest of who can get the most laughs. Can you guess who wins???

13.title: Joke or Treat...
13.plot: Ashleigh enjoys her Halloween candy a little too much. Instead of having candy left over to pass out to trick or treaters on Halloween, Ashleigh attempts to give out what she thinks is even better...JOKES.

imdb.plot outline: Actress, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, needs a job and tries her best to become a stand-up comedian but she has a conflict, she has kids. With no job and no money, Ashleigh has to borrow her kids' microphone and curtain (their shower curtain might we add) to stage her stand-up comedy act. Ashleigh also has to rely upon the feedback her kids give her, before going around town and trying her comedy act on different people she come across in her everyday life as a mom...her son's teacher, the cashier at the grocery store, a mom in a toy store, the order taker at a fast food restaurant, and on and on and on. Will Ashleigh ever get good enough to have her own comedy show? Only time, and her job as a mom, will tell. Yet in the eyes of her oldest son, "My Mom's A Joke!"
imdb.title: My Mom's a Joke
plot: A mockumentary following the life of a single Mom attempting to make it as a stand-up comedian.

Actress, ASHLEIGH NICOLE JOHNSON, needs a job and tries her best to become a stand-up comedian but she has a conflict, she has kids. With no job and no money, Ashleigh has to borrow her kids' microphone and curtain (their shower curtain might we add) to stage her stand-up comedy act. Ashleigh also has to rely upon the feedback her kids give her, before going around town and trying her comedy act on different people she come across in her everyday life as a mom...her son's teacher, the cashier at the grocery store, a mom in a toy store, the order taker at a fast food restaurant, and on and on and on. Will Ashleigh ever get good enough to have her own comedy show? Only time, and her job as a mom, will tell. Yet in the eyes of her oldest son, "My Mom's A Joke!"::Sabra R. Smith
